exclusion:
1. Start Z-Wave exclusion.
  2. Quickly press the switch button 3 times.

If successful, the LED will turn green for 3 seconds.
inclusion:
1. Start Z-Wave inclusion.
  2. Quickly press the switch button 3 times.

The LED indicator will blink blue to signal communications and turn green for 3 seconds if inclusion is successful or turn red for 3 seconds if the pairing attempt fails.
label: ZEN32
overview:
Features

  • Switch button: 15 A relay for Z-Wave on/off control
  • 4 remote control buttons: trigger scenes and control other devices in your Z-Wave network from this switch
  • NEW 700 series Z-Wave chip for better range and faster control
  • Direct 3-Way: works with regular on/off switches in a 3-way
  • Scene control: trigger actions with multi-tap (select hubs only)
  • Smart bulb mode: disable relay and control the light via Z-Wave
  • Adjustable LED indicator in 4 colors and 3 brightness levels
  • S2 Security and SmartStart for easier inclusion

Specifications

  • Model Number: ZEN32
  • Z-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz
  • Power: 120 VAC, 60 Hz
  • Maximum Load: 150W LED, 960W Incandescent, 1800W (15A) Resistive, 3A motor (DON'T use with receptacles)
  • Range: Up to 500 feet line of sight
  • Operating Temperature: 32-104°F (0-40°C)
  • Installation and Use: Indoor only
usage:
• SWITCH BUTTON: on/off of connected load, reports association Group 1 lifeline to the controller, Group 2 basic set, Group 3 multilevel; reports Scene 5 with 7 attributes (actions)
  • BUTTON 1: Group 4 basic set, Group 5 multilevel; Scene 1 (7 actions)
  • BUTTON 2: Group 6 basic set, Group 7 multilevel; Scene 2 (7 actions)
  • BUTTON 3: Group 8 basic set, Group 9 multilevel; Scene 3 (7 actions)
  • BUTTON 4: Group 10 basic set, Group 11 multilevel; Scene 4 (7 actions)

If your primary controller is missing or inoperable, you may need to reset the device to factory settings. To reset the device to factory settings, press and hold the switch button for 20 seconds until the LED indicator starts flashing red. Release the button, and immediately after, tap remote button 1 once to complete the reset. The LED indicators on all buttons will flash red to confirm a successful reset. Note: all previously recorded activity and custom settings will be erased from the device's memory.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: Relay Button LED State
channels.overview:
0 - LED on when dimmer off, LED off when dimmer on (default) 

1 - LED on when dimmer on, LED off when dimmer off 

 2 - LED always off 

 3  - LED always on

parameters.label: LED Indicator mode for relay
parameters.overview: Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when the relay is on or off, or if you want it to remain on or off at all times.

options.label: LED on when relay off, LED off when relay on (default)
LED on when relay on, LED off when relay off

parameters.overview: Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when Button 1 is on or off, or if you want it to remain on or off at all times.

options.label: LED on when dimmer off, LED off when dimmer on (default)
LED on when dimmer on, LED off when dimmer off

options.label: LED on when dimmer off, LED off when dimmer on (default)

parameters.label: LED Indicator color for relay
parameters.overview:
Choose the color of the LED indicator for the relay.

0 – white (default); 1 – blue; 2 – green; 3 – red

parameters.label: LED Indicator color for Button 1
parameters.overview:
Choose the color of the LED indicator for Button 1.

0 – white (default); 1 – blue; 2 – green; 3 – red

parameters.overview: Choose the color of the LED indicator for Button 2.

parameters.overview:

parameters.label: LED Indicator brightness for relay
parameters.overview: Choose the LED indicator's brightness level for the relay.

parameters.label: LED Indicator brightness for Button 1
parameters.overview: Choose the LED indicator's brightness level for Button 1.

parameters.label: LED Indicator brightness for Button 2
parameters.overview: Choose the LED indicator's brightness level for Button 2.

parameters.label: LED Indicator brightness for Button 3
parameters.overview: Choose the LED indicator's brightness level for Button 3.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer for Relay
parameters.overview:
Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-off timer function (the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn off once it has been turned on).

0 – disabled (default); 1 – 65535 (minutes)

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer for Relay
parameters.overview:
Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-on timer function (the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn on once it has been turned off).

0 – disabled (default); 1 – 65535 (minutes)

parameters.label: State After Power Failure
parameters.overview: Set the on off status for the switch after power failure.

options.label: Relay and buttons remember and restore last state (default)
Relay and buttons forced to off after power failure
Relay and buttons forced to on after power failure

parameters.label: Disable / Enable Control on the Relay
parameters.description: Disable / Enable Control on the Relay
parameters.overview:
Enable or disable paddle on/off control (aka disable the relay). If disabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through buttons.

Values: 0 – Disable local / physical control (from the button), enable Z-Wave control; 1 – Enable local / physical control (from the button), enable Z-Wave control (default); 2 – Disable local / physical control (from the button), disable Z-Wave control

options.label: Disable local control, enable Z-Wave control
Enable local control, enable Z-Wave control (default)
Disable local control, disable Z-Wave control

parameters.label: Relay Behavior with Disabled Local / Z-Wave Control
parameters.description: Relay Behavior with Disabled Local / Z-Wave Control
parameters.overview:
Set reporting behavior for disabled physical control.

Values: 0 – report on/off status when button is pressed and change LED indicator status if Parameter 19 is set to value 0 or 2; 1 – DON’T report on/off status when button is pressed and DON’T change LED indicator status if Parameter 19 is set to value 0 or 2 (but the relay will always send central scene command) (default)

parameters.label: 3-Way Switch Type
parameters.overview:
Choose the type of 3-way switch you want to use with this switch in a 3-way set-up.

Values: 0 – regular mechanical 3-way on/off switch, use the connected 3-way switch to turn the light on or off (default); 1 – momentary switch, click once to change status (light on or off)

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: Main button binary switch (Z-Wave) / basic set (button) lifeline to hub

associations.label: Basic Set (relay)
associations.overview: Main relay button basic set (pressed only, doesn’t send anything when switch turned on via hub)

associations.label: Multilevel (#1)
associations.overview: Small button #1 multilevel (held) > in sequence > held = increase brightness, release = stop level, held = decrease brightness, release = stop level

associations.label: Multilevel (#2)
associations.overview: Small button #2 multilevel (held) > in sequence > held = increase brightness, release = stop level, held = decrease brightness, release = stop level

associations.label: Multilevel (#3)
associations.overview: Small button #3 multilevel (held) > in sequence > held = increase brightness, release = stop level, held = decrease brightness, release = stop level

associations.label: Multilevel (#4)
associations.overview: Small button #4 multilevel (held) > in sequence > held = increase brightness, release = stop level, held = decrease brightness, release = stop level
